results.title: The Place at the coast
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1961, Ellie and her father travel to the seaside town of Kilkee for their annual holiday. For a time, the two enjoy their past routines - Ellie, a keen naturalist, observing and recording the native wildlife, her father fishing. However, a tourist development plan is proposed to extend and change their summer retreat, and Ellie soon learns that she is alone in her opposition to change. Cast includes John Hargreaves, Heather Mitchell, Tushka Bergen.

results.title: The Place Across the River
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, David Greig and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Explore the rich history of Melbourne through the National Gallery of Victoria site in St Kilda Road, Melbourne, via its various uses, as a circus site in 1887 to the landmark cultural centre it became. Mixes found footage, stills and contemporary footage.

results.title: The Pizzini Family
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a story about an Italian-Australian family made unique by three generations of winemakers and master chefs. Meet Natalie, Alfred, Arnold, Katrina, Carla and matriarch Rosetta Pizzini, hear about the four brothers that immigrated to Australia and started farming tobacco, eventually diversifying to growing Italian variety grapes. The Pizzini’s make their own wine, run a cooking school and manage a boutique hotel in Whitfield, but still the most important part of their day is when they sit together and share a meal, a glass of wine and a laugh.

results.title: The Pitch
results.brief_description: Films aren’t always plotted from start to finish. In animated films, teams of artists often develop scenes and stories that are then performed to show how the rhythm and visuals will fit in the completed film. This is the ‘pitch’ and it’s an integral part of storyboarding.

constellations_primary.name: The Pitch
constellations_primary.description: Explore fantastical worlds and underwater seascapes.

results.description:
Films aren’t always plotted from start to finish. In animated films, teams of artists often develop scenes and stories that are then performed to show how the rhythm and visuals will fit in the completed film. This is the ‘pitch’ and it’s an integral part of storyboarding. Because of the close relationship between story, pacing and drawing, storyboard artists need to be performers, storytellers and visual artists.

Conrad Vernon was a storyboard artist on Shrek (2001) and co-director on Shrek 2 (2004), as well as the voice of the Gingerbread Man in the series. In this scene from Shrek, Lord Farquaad ruthlessly (and hilariously) interrogates Gingerbread Man to find the whereabouts of Duloc’s exiled fairytale creatures.

Tom McGrath was a storyboard artist, writer and co-director on the Madagascar trilogy, as well the voice of Skipper in the series. In this scene from Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008), the zoo animals take off in a rickety plane with high hopes of it returning them safely to New York City.

results.title: The Pitcairn people
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: A record of the life today of the people of Pitcairn Island, two square miles of volcanic rock in the Pacific, where the mutineers from the Bounty started a new life in 1790.

results.title: The Pirogue maker
results.creator_credit: Arnold Eagle and Humble Oil and Refining Company
results.brief_description: The shaping of a small boat known as a pirogue, from a cypress tree trunk; an intriguing record of a fast-dying art by descendents of the Acadians who left Nova Scotia in 1755. Flaherty’s films “Louisiana story” led to the tracing of one of the few remaining pirogue makers, Hebron Allemand whose work was recorded with Acadian folk songs giving local background.

results.title: The Pirates of Penzance
results.creator_credit: Wilford Leach, Joseph Papp and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Frederic (Rex Smith) has been apprenticed to a pirate crew by mistake and when his term finishes he attempts to bring them to justice. Presenting a film adaptation of the classic Gilbert and Sullivan opera with music orchestrated, arranged and conducted by William Elliott, choreography by Graciela Daniele and cast including Kevin Kline (Pirate King), Angela lansbury (Ruth), Linda Ronstadt (Mabel) and George Rose (Major-General).

results.title: The Pirates of Penzance
results.brief_description: Gilbert and Sullivan’s riotous tale of reformed pirates stars Keith Michell and Peter Allen, with the London Symphony Orchestra and Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Considered by some G & S enthusiasts as not a good example of Gilbert and Sullivan at its best.

results.title: The Pirate's gold
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: A dying pirate hides treasure in an old woman’s cottage. Many years later, when her son is in great need, it comes to light. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Arthur V. Johnson, Tony O’Sullivan, mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Pirate
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the West Indies, a young Manuela (Judy Garland) is told by her aunt Inez that arrangements are being made for her to wed the mysterious new mayor of the town, Don Pedro Vargas (Walter Slezak). Manuela is crushed, as it signals an end to her fantasies of being swept off her feet by the legend of the romantic, yet notorious pirate - Macoco. Being a dutiful surrogate daughter to the aunt and uncle who have been like parents to her, Manuel agrees to the marriage, and they soon take a short trip to the Caribbean island of San Sebastian. As fate will have it, a magician and his troupe arrive in San Sebastian at the same time, ready to perform for the locals. The magician is taken by Manuela’s beauty, and after a failed attempt to seduce her, convinces her to come along to the show. The magician tries to win Manuela’s heart by impersonating the man of her dreams, the pirate Macoco, and during his performance hypnotises then kisses her. Now totally smitten, the “pirate” Serafin follows Manuela home to try and convince her to run away with him, only to be discovered by Don Pedro Vargas, who is recognised by the magician as being the “real” Macoco. Based on the play of the same name by S. N. Behrman, as produced by The Playwrights Producing Company and The Theatre Guild. Cast also includes Gladys Cooper and Reginald Owen. Songs by Cole Porter.
